docs.lead_paragraph: Enrollment in the program grew only modestly as well, but that may change as millions of people are due to become eligible in 2014 under the new national health care law, a survey found.

headline.main: Spending on Medicaid Has Slowed, Survey Finds
headline.print_headline: Spending On Medicaid Has Slowed, Survey Finds

docs.abstract: Survey by Kaiser Family Foundation finds annual growth in spending on Medicaid slowed sharply in fiscal year ending in June as economy began to improve, and enrollment in program grew only modestly as well; trend may change as millions of people are due to become eligible in 2014 under new national health care law.
docs.snippet: Enrollment in the program grew only modestly as well, but that may change as millions of people are due to become eligible in 2014 under the new national health care law, a survey found.

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney has promised to accomplish 15 different tasks on Day 1 of his administration. Let's sort them by priority.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney has promised to accomplish 15 different tasks on Day 1 of his administration. Let's sort them by priority.

headline.main: Challenging Assumptions in the Push for Better Care

docs.abstract: A new study analyzed a central assumption of one proposed change to medical practice: that patients who enjoy regular access to their primary doctors cost less. That is true, the study found - but for different reasons than previously assumed.
docs.snippet: A new study analyzed a central assumption of one proposed change to medical practice: that patients who enjoy regular access to their primary doctors cost less. That is true, the study found - but for different reasons than previously assumed.

headline.main: McKesson to Buy PSS World Medical for $1.46 Billion

docs.abstract: The McKesson Corporation, the health care services and information technology company, has agreed to buy PSS World Medical for $29 a share.
docs.snippet: The McKesson Corporation, the health care services and information technology company, has agreed to buy PSS World Medical for $29 a share.

docs.lead_paragraph: While female voters generally tend to favor President Obama, that cannot be said of white women without college degrees, a subset known — in this race — as waitress moms.

headline.seo: Female Swing Voters, a Coveted Demographic
headline.main: Crucial Subset: Female Voters Still Deciding
headline.print_headline: Crucial Subset: Female Voters Still Deciding

docs.abstract: Subset of women voters in 2012 presidential election represent coveted swing votes, undecided between Pres Obama, who they say has not lived up to expectations, and Mitt Romney, who they fear could set women back because he does not understand their needs; intense competition for female voters, especially blue-collar white women who did not attend college, is underscored in remarks made by both candidates throughout the campaign.
docs.snippet: While female voters generally tend to favor President Obama, that cannot be said of white women without college degrees, a subset known — in this race — as waitress moms.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some of the nastiest and most personal House battles in the country can found in Florida, where one candidate told another to “shut up” in a debate.

headline.seo: Insults and Accusations Fly in Florida’s House Races
headline.main: Politics Can Be a Dirty Business. And Then There Are House Races in Florida ...
headline.print_headline: Politics Can Be a Dirty Business. And Then There Are House Races in Florida ...

docs.abstract: Florida is home to some of nastiest and most personal House campaigns in country, even in election year awash with partisan fury; ad hominem attacks and ruthless political advertisements have become the norm, as candidates compete for small number of deciding votes in swing state.
docs.snippet: Some of the nastiest and most personal House battles in the country can found in Florida, where one candidate told another to “shut up” in a debate.
